body: No, not yet. It really is only possible once ASM supports it properly where ASM is still in beta but I am currently working on a release with experimental support (`-Dnet.bytebuddy.experimental=true`) which should come out today (*1.9.14*).
The new Byte Buddy version is released now, you can include it manually and set the experimental option and it should work.
#1063 was just closed by upgrading to a recent Groovy 3 beta release.

I've enabled byte-buddy's experimental option in 7b2ed227c276bcb2194a6224dbb604ebbbabd736 and was able to run a local build on OpenJDK 14-valhalla+2-18.

However, there's still no openjdk Docker image that we could use for Azure.

Trying with @shipilev 's docker image at https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/compare/issues/1936-jdk-14

Container's up and runnin' https://dev.azure.com/junit-team/junit5/_build/results?buildId=507

Only the correct path to `JAVA_HOME` is missing...
`JAVA_HOME` should be fixed now, along with other environment variables in `shipilev:openjdk-latest-*`. Please try again.

Azure Pipelines seems to create its own users and run commands in the container using it:

![AwesomeScreenshot-20190715-2-junit-team-junit5-2019-07-15-14-07-64](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/214207/61217360-c8663400-a70f-11e9-9268-015d25ecf287.png)
https://dev.azure.com/junit-team/junit5/_build/results?buildId=508&view=logs&jobId=1aad50ee-49f1-5da3-3759-715a0d68312e&taskId=51f9df4a-090a-49c5-b774-b94af3795e7b&lineStart=47&lineEnd=48&colStart=1&colEnd=1

Which doesn't work with this image because Java is installed in `/root/jdk`.

Still `ERROR: JAVA_HOME is set to an invalid directory: /opt/jdk`

https://dev.azure.com/junit-team/junit5/_build/results?buildId=509

I think the file permissions are still too restrictive:

```
# ls -al /opt/jdk/
total 32
drwxr-xr-x  7 root root 4096 Jul 15 13:05 .
drwxr-xr-x  1 root root 4096 Jul 15 13:05 ..
drwx------  2 root root 4096 Jul 14 21:31 bin
drwx------  5 root root 4096 Jul 14 21:31 conf
drwx------  3 root root 4096 Jul 14 21:31 include
drwx------ 72 root root 4096 Jul 14 21:31 legal
drwx------  5 root root 4096 Jul 14 21:31 lib
-rw-------  1 root root 1184 Jul 14 21:31 release
```

Grrr. Fixed to `a+rx`: 
```
$ docker run --rm -it shipilev/openjdk:14-fastdebug ls -la /opt/jdk/
total 32
drwxr-xr-x  7 root root 4096 Jul 15 15:31 .
drwxr-xr-x  3 root root 4096 Jul 15 15:31 ..
drwxr-xr-x  2 root root 4096 Jul 14 21:31 bin
drwxr-xr-x  5 root root 4096 Jul 14 21:31 conf
drwxr-xr-x  3 root root 4096 Jul 14 21:31 include
drwxr-xr-x 72 root root 4096 Jul 14 21:31 legal
drwxr-xr-x  5 root root 4096 Jul 14 21:31 lib
-rwxr-xr-x  1 root root 1184 Jul 14 21:31 release
```

... build has started! ðŸš€ 

```
------------------------------------------------------------
Gradle 5.5.1
------------------------------------------------------------
Build time:   2019-07-10 20:38:12 UTC
Revision:     3245f748c7061472da4dc184991919810f7935a5
Kotlin:       1.3.31
Groovy:       2.5.4
Ant:          Apache Ant(TM) version 1.9.14 compiled on March 12 2019
JVM:          14-testing (Aleksey Shipilev 14-testing+0-builds.shipilev.net-openjdk-jdk-b935-20190714-jdk-145)
OS:           Linux 4.15.0-1047-azure amd64
```

FWIW I submitted a PR to the repo that builds the official Docker images:
https://github.com/docker-library/openjdk/pull/343
